results.title: Phar Lap: the people's champion [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Eddie Carnana, Michael Dickinson, Rhett Kirkwood and Hall of Fame Corporation
results.brief_description: The People’s champion, Phar Lap, is an icon of Australia’s past. This video contains previously unseen footage of the greatest thoroughbred there ever was. Footage is contributed featuring Tommy Woodcock, Harry Telford and American businessman David Davis, as well as including the amazing story of Cups King Bart Cummings, whose record 10 Melbourne Cup triumphs is equally worthy of praise.

results.title: Newsfront [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Richard Brennan, David Elfick and Palm Beach Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the newsreel cameramen who lived and worked in Australia during the golden era of the newsreel from 1948 to 1956. Len Maguire is a top cameraman whose devotion to his work and loyalty to his company creates conflict with both his colleagues and the people he loves. Amy is a production assistant working in a predominantly male environment and Len’s brother, Frank, heads the Australian branch of an American newsreel company in competition with Len’s company.

results.title: The Moka festival
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: This film shows the Moka Festival which is held deep in the heart of New Guinea. The many tribes walk great distances carrying with them a live pig lashed to a pole. The pig represents a major feature of the Moka ceremony. Wealthy chiefs distribute their wealth to the less fortunate chiefs and pigs and shells are currency between the villages. The tribal people adorn themselves with paint and feathers and dance at the “festival of giving”. Photography by Arnold M. Maahs.

results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: Swiss Society for Combating Cancer and American Cancer Society
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.

results.title: Trip to Mars
results.brief_description: Magical animation details the extraterrestial adventures of hand-drawn harlequin, Koko the clown. Reluctant astronaut Koko inadvertantly launches Mr. Fleischer skyward and the two conclude their supernatural reverie in a ‘taxi-crab’ flung to the rings of Saturn. Koko’s martian odyssey reveals a wealth of unlikely and outlandish natives.

results.title: Looking for Alibrandi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Robyn Kershaw, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Premium Movie Partnership and AFFC
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by first time writer Melina Marchetta, “Looking for Alibrandi” is an affectionate look at three generations of strong willed Italian women, and the youngest member, Josie’s (Pia Miranda) attempt to break the family “curse”. 17 year old Josie lives with her single mother Christina (Greta Scacchi), is completing her HSC at an exclusive Sydney school on a scholarship, begrudgingly visiting her Nonna, defending the labels of “wog” and “bastard”, and longing after the lifestyle afforded to rich kids with both parents. When her father, Michael (Anthony La Paglia) enters their lives again, Josie confronts her mother and her Nonna about the rift between Christina and her father, and the animosity between mother and daughter to reveal secrets long since hidden. Josie must also make decisions about her future career and what her heart desires as she is torn between school captain John Barton (Matthew Newton) and public school boy Jacob (Kick Gurry). Between work, school, family and personal relationships, Josie discovers that life is filled with uncertainty and she is not the only one debilitated by the labels society ascribes. This was the first feature film effort for both director Woods and actor Miranda. Remarkably, the film was nominated and won several AFI awards, including best film, best supporting actress (Scacchi) and best performance by an actress in a leading role (Miranda).
